name: eWaterways
overview:
eWaterways is an global aggregator of small ship cruises. It sells directly to the consumer and through agents, offering ships of between 4 and 150 cabins.

With offices in London, Paris, Philadelphia, Melbourne and Bucharest, eWaterways works with more than 400 cruise line suppliers and more than 9,000 travel agencies worldwide.

The company was founded in 2008 by Daniela Wagner, Chief Executive Officer, and Soren Langelund, Chief Operating Officer.

Wagner was Managing Director of OctopusTravel for 5 years and spent 13 years at the World Travel & Tourism Council and the European Tour Operators Assosiation.

Langelund has more than 30 years experience in senior management in the travel industry, based in the Middle East, South East Asia and the UK. He has been Head of Travel Services at EMEA for RCI Europe, Vice President at AMEX Corporate Travel, and Head of Business Development at Opodo.

The company is a member of the Association of Cruise Experts, the Passenger Shipping Association, the Cruise Lines International Association, the United States Tour Operator Association and the European Tour Operators Association.
